google_bigquery_table.description: Creates a table resource in a dataset for Google BigQuery.

dataset_id.description: The dataset ID to create the table in.

table_id.description: A unique ID for the resource.

project.description: The ID of the project in which the resource belongs. If it

expiration_time.description: The time when this table expires, in

friendly_name.description: A descriptive name for the table.

encryption_configuration.description: Specifies how the table should be encrypted.

labels.description: A mapping of labels to assign to the resource.

schema.description: A JSON schema for the table. Schema is required

clustering.description: Specifies column names to use for data clustering.

view.description: If specified, configures this table as a view.

autodetect.description: - Let BigQuery try to autodetect the schema

compression.description: - The compression type of the data source.

max_bad_records.description: - The maximum number of bad records that

source_format.description: - The data format. Supported values are:

source_uris.description: A list of the fully-qualified URIs that point to

quote.description: - The value that is used to quote data sections in a

allow_jagged_rows.description: - Indicates if BigQuery should accept rows

encoding.description: - The character encoding of the data. The supported

field_delimiter.description: - The separator for fields in a CSV file.

skip_leading_rows.description: - The number of rows at the top of the sheet

range.description: Information required to partition based on ranges.

expiration_ms.description: Number of milliseconds for which to keep the

field.description: The field used to determine how to create a range-based

type.description: The only type supported is DAY, which will generate

require_partition_filter.description: If set to true, queries over this table

start.description: Start of the range partitioning, inclusive.

end.description: End of the range partitioning, exclusive.

interval.description: The width of each range within the partition.

query.description: A query that BigQuery executes when the view is referenced.

use_legacy_sql.description: Specifies whether to use BigQuery's legacy SQL for this view.

kms_key_name.description: The self link or full name of a key which should be used to

creation_time.description: The time when this table was created, in milliseconds since the epoch.

last_modified_time.description: The time when this table was last modified, in milliseconds since the epoch.

location.description: The geographic location where the table resides. This value is inherited from the dataset.

num_bytes.description: The size of this table in bytes, excluding any data in the streaming buffer.

num_long_term_bytes.description: The number of bytes in the table that are considered "long-term storage".

num_rows.description: The number of rows of data in this table, excluding any data in the streaming buffer.

self_link.description: The URI of the created resource.
